nodes.bodyText: The assertEquals params should be reversed I believe. assertEquals(expected, actual)
This branch should be an exceptional one.. maybe we should log some kind of error here.  There is a survey on a device but when attempting to retrieve its assignment we find nothing

As the numbers are not important, use (rand-int) instead of hardcoded numbers, so that it is obvious that is "any int" and not "this particular int", because the fact that 3 out of 4 are 1L but not the other makes me wonder if those that are 1L are somehow related.
Also, using 1L for all means that maybe there is some bug in the order of parameters and it is not catch by the tests.
Does this part of the test has anything to do with the previous part about dataPointAssignmentDao? If not, move to another tests
These are two different tests. Please split in two.
Why is this important for this test?
This use of servlet was really unexpected. I was expecting all the tests to be testing at the same layer, so either the DAO layer or the servlet layer.

This special value is not obvious where it is used in the tests.
Also, try to remove comment by making the test say the same.

I really dislike special values like [0]. They always cause problems.
Did you discard the option of adding a flag in the survey assignment objects?

We're storing [0] for All data points as in the JDO/Dao writes/reads a List of ids (longs). Instead of storing a potential large List of Ids, we have a constant that represent all current and future datapoints for a Survey.

I feel that my question was not understood. Rephrasing it:
Did you discard the option of adding an explicit flag/field in SurveyAssignment object to mean "ALL DATAPOINTS" or "PARTIAL DATAPOINTS"?
"Duplicated code is better than a wrong abstraction" , we only have 3?
""Duplication is the root of all evil". Even with 1, it is going to make the tests more readable.
Perhaps we should return a 404 instead? @valllllll2000 how would the device behave when we return one of these error codes?
